body.p: The Board’s view in developing the 2010 ED was that gains and losses arise on settlements because of a difference between the defined benefit obligation, as remeasured at the transaction date, and the settlement amount. Therefore, the 2010 ED proposed that:

li.p: gains and losses on settlements should be treated in the same way as actuarial gains and losses, by being included in the remeasurements component; and
the effect of plan amendments and curtailments should be included in the service cost component.
